content.text:
[@micro](@wsoeSOhEE3yAIEF1gTVMeStUWnoejIz1P6a3lnvjaOM=.ed25519)

I saw [@ev](@8Qee0I/DwI5DHSCi3p5fsl6FyLGArrnDz3ox9qZr5Qc=.ed25519) mention cjdns above, but I'm not sure I understand what the difference is (or why we wouldn't use something like cjdns for this use-case). For example, [@libra.fraction.io](@gTsBPQbdSd763h0qoZsBjPlgWbhKKmMFW8kmTv/XrV8=.ed25519) is running 100% over an IPv6 address from cjdns.

I'm sure you're more knowledgeable on this than I am, do you have any recommended reading that might help me understand this better? Thanks!
